dialogues.speaker: EXT. SILVERLAKE STREET. LATER
dialogues.text: Calvin stands in his sweats at the side of the road. His body has obviously not seen sunlight for quite some time. Calvin's dog SCOTTY, small and sensitive, sniffs around.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Go potty. Go potty. Go potty. Go potty. Go potty. Go potty. Scotty. Go potty. Scotty squats and pees like a girl dog. INT. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. LATER. This is a nicer house than we would expect a guy this you to have. Very little furniture, but everything is expensi Calvin pours coffee. Toast pops up. Scotty waits for scra  He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 2. INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. LATER. Calvin places the toast and coffee carefully next to the typewriter on his desk. Everything in the room is white: desk, floor, walls. Scotty tries to come in. Calvin shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No Scotty. Calvin sits. Silence. He positions his hands over the key A page sits in the typewriter. Blank. Calvin's face. Also blank. CUT between the page and Calvin. It’s like a staring contest. The phone rings, loud, jarring. Calvin answers.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes? INT. GYM. MORNING. Calvin and Harry are strapped into weight machines that b more than a passing similarity to Medieval torture device Harry stands next to Calvin, spotting him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Great way to start the day, right?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I think I’m going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How was your date last week?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Okay as in you got laid?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Harry. He gestures at a woman working out next to them, earbuds

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What? She can’t hear you. (Loud) Don’t you want to have sex? Like ever again? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: The only reason girls ever want to sleep with me is that they read my book in high school.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: So they're not interested in me, they’re interested in...some idea of me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That’s why you have to work out. So they’11 want you for your body.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (RE: the machine) What does this thing even do?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It turns you into a god. Keep it up.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: .-.-I had a weird dream last night. There was this girl--

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What’d she look like?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ...like a normal girl, someone I made up.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did you have sex?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No, she just talked to me.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's fucking depressing.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: It was actually really nice.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Seriously? You don’t even get laid in your dreams? That’s just sad. (He finishes his reps.) So how’s the book coming? 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 4. INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE. LATE AFTERNOON. CLOSE UP on Calvin's face, looking up at camera.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t know. I get an idea, a good idea, like, why don’t I write about my dad? And BAM, I start thinking that is the stupidest thing ever, who wants to read about “He was disappointed in me, bla bla bla.” But then I’m sitting there, alone, in front of my typewriter all day, and maybe I get something to eat, and all I can think about is how every second I’m getting older and he was right, what am I doing with my life? And also. Also I am feeling ambivalent about Scotty. A beat. We hold on Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s true. I’m feeling very ambivalent about Scotty. Dogs can be really annoying. He slobbers. He chews things. He pees like a girl, which for some reason makes me feel inadequate. But then I feel bad, because if I don’t love him, who will? (Pause) Plus he needs to go outside a lot, and it breaks up my day. Maybe that’s why I’m not writing? We see: DR. ROSENTHAL. Smart, fifties. He looks bemused.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Do you think that’s why you’re not writing? Calvin has somehow managed to squish his body into a feta position in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Why do you think you’re not writing?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ...Can I have Bobby now? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 5.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Do you need Bobby now?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yes. Dr. Rosenthal gets up and goes to a cabinet. Calvin follo him with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Calvin. When was the last time you saw a friend?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Harry, yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Someone other than your brother? Calvin doesn’t answer. Dr. Rosenthal comes over and hands him a plush teddy bear: Bobby. Calvin holds it. Dr. Rosenthal goes back to his seat.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How was your date Tuesday? Calvin plays with Bobby's ears.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know that I’m really a dating kind of person. Just the prospect of like...childhood stories, relationship histories, “You’re depressed? Oh my god I’m depressed”... Besides, if I haven’t written that day, that’s all I can think about. Have you been giving Bobby to your other patients?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: No, Bobby’s just for you.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ‘Cause he smells weird.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Calvin. When you were deciding to get Scotty, what did we talk about? What did you say you hoped for? Do you remember? Calvin mutters something.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A little louder please. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: That he would be awesome and we’d take hikes and stuff. And I would meet people when they stopped to pet him. But Scotty gets scared when people try to pet him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Does that embarrass you?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (Big fat lie) No.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: .-.I want to give you a writing assignment.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I can’t write.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Okay. This would just be for me. I'd like you to write, just a page, about someone who sees Scotty, all slobbery and scared, and likes him anyway. Just the way he is. Do you think you could do that for me? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Can it be bad?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I would like it to be very bad. INT. HAMMER MUSEUM. EVENING. CLOSE ON: Scattered hardcover books surround A BLOWN UP POSTER OF A BOOK COVER propped on a table. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: HEARTBROKEN OLD TIMES
dialogues.text: By Calvin Weir-Fields ~Tenth Anniversary Edition~

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The first time I met Calvin, he was 19 years old and had already been at the top of the New York Times Best Seller List for months. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A crowd of well-dressed people sit watching: LANGDON THAR literary god. Late forties and enjoying the attention fro the stage.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought: who the fuck is this kid? And how can I go back in time and be him? Laughter. Calvin stands in the wings.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This skinny high school drop out with acne still on his chin gave us what very well may become a classic American novel. Someone pats Calvin on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since then, we've had the pleasure of reading his short stories, and of course last year’s novella “Breakfast for Dinner.” But it wasn’t until I sat down to re-read his novel-- (Holding up the book) --in this beautiful new edition--that I remembered quite how good Calvin Weir- Fields is. Langdon turns, a strange edge to his voice.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ten years ago or ten years from now, we're lucky to have him around. Ladies and Gentlemen, Calvin Weir-Fields. People applaud. Calvin walks onstage. Langdon shakes his hand. Flashbulbs. Calvin takes the mic, ready to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin splashes water on his face. Water drips off his ha nose, eyelashes. He looks like a drowning man. INT. MUSEUM. HALL. JUST AFTER. Calvin walks down the wall. Cyrus pops in from around the corner. Cyrus is either a good guy who comes off as a dou or a douche who gives phenomenal “good-guy.” No one knows

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: There’s the man! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 8.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You have to remind me about these things.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Check your messages buddy.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I would have at least worn a real shirt.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: No one cares what you wear, you’re a genius.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Don’t use that word. INT. MUSEUM AUDITORIUM. JUST AFTER. Calvin makes his way up the stairs out of the auditorium. People press forward to speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY-GOER 1
dialogues.text: Phenomenal, man. Just brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: PARTY-GOER 2
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Thanks for coming.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER DUDE
dialogues.text: Hey, man, you know that chapter where Charlie goes to the whorehouse? Did you make the whore’s dress blue because it was the same color as his mother’s apron?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ...Sorry, what? A SORT OF WEIRD GUY cuts in, a little too close to Calvin

dialogues.speaker: SORT OF WEIRD GUY
dialogues.text: Calvin. Calvin. Calvin. So. How did you know where to send your manuscript?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Uh, I looked it up.

dialogues.speaker: SORT OF WEIRD GUY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: On the internet. +e HF FF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 11 12 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 9.

dialogues.speaker: SORT OF WEIRD GUY
dialogues.text: But you were a teenager.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: SORT OF WEIRD GUY
dialogues.text: Is it weird for you that you used to be so successful? INT. MUSEUM. RECEPTION AREA (BY BILLY WILDER PORTRAIT). Langdon pulls Calvin into a group of writers for a photo.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Say “Disillusionment.” No one smiles. Flashbulbs go off. Cyrus steps in.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Hey, Cyrus Modi, huge fan. INT. MUSEUM. RECEPTION AREA. LATER. The crowd mills about. The Sort Of Weird Guy chats up Calvin. Cyrus interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Look, pink litchi-tinis!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hold this.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: I know it looks gay. Try holding two of them. Now go, sign copies, sell books.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I was thinking of heading home. Cyrus laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LATER. 12
dialogues.text: Party is more intense. A CUTE HIPSTER GIRL tries to chat Calvin at the bar. They both have to shout over the noise

dialogues.speaker: CUTE HIPSTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Mabel!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 10.

dialogues.speaker: CUTE HIPSTER GIRL
dialogues.text: I’m Mabel!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: MABEL
dialogues.text: (Holding out a scrap of paper) No, do you want my number? LATER. ELEVATOR FOYER. Calvin is sandwiched between the Coordinator and MICHAEL SILVERBLATT, talking intently into his ear. They head int the bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL SILVERBLATT
dialogues.text: You know my show Bookworm--?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course I--

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL SILVERBLATT
dialogues.text: Well, I have to tell you I love the first book, but what we really want is for you to come on the show and talk about what you’re working on now, NOW is the question-- LATER. BOOKSTORE. Langdon chats up some women.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Of course, Calvin always had talent, but that will only get you so far. I helped hone him, give him some style. It was a passing of the baton, really. LATER. Mabel continues to hit on Calvin as he signs her book.

dialogues.speaker: MABEL
dialogues.text: My favorite was that story you had in McSweeny’s last fall? About the guy trying to buy a jacket? LATER. Langdon chats up some more women. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH OK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HH OH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 11.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Everyone sits at home and thinks, “I could do that, a monkey could do that.” But one’s muse is incredibly difficult. You have to seduce her, finesse her. LATER. A tiny intimidating older FEMALE PROFESSOR intensely grip Calvin’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PROFESSOR
dialogues.text: At first I resisted teaching your book, but the longer I considered it, the more I saw its corollary to Roth and Mailer, so I thought, if I’m going to include anyone contemporary, it really must be Calvin Weir-Fields-- LATER. Langdon chats up even more women.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: People think of writing as cerebral, but its actually an incredibly physical, almost sensual act. You should see me write. I’m like an Olympian. With a pen. LATER. Mabel’s kneeling by the table as Calvin signs other peopl books. She has a drink.

dialogues.speaker: MABEL
dialogues.text: I was so in love with Charlie. He was like my ideal in high school. I mean I know he’s not real. But he kind of is, right? Like, your name starts with “C” and so does Charlie... I mean, it’s like autobiographical, right? LATER. Quieter. Langdon leans against a wall by Calvin. Drunk.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: They love you and then they throw you away. It’s easier if you’ve only ever been mediocre. When you’ve been to the top, it can kill you. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH HH FH HHH HH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13 14 15 16 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 12.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Salinger had the right idea: write what you can, and then DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK. SILENT. THEN
dialogues.text: A door opens. We are: INT. CALVIN’S HOUSE. NIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 13 Calvin's silhouette in the doorway. He tosses his copy of the book on the floor. Shuts the door behind him. INT. CALVIN'S BEDROOM. JUST AFTER. 14 The door opens revealing Scotty asleep on the floor by th bed. There are many torn up books around him. of urine. Also a puddle Calvin examines the remains of the books. One of them was his copy of “CATCHER IN THE RYE.” Calvin lets it drop fro his fingers in defeat or exhaustion. INT. CALVIN'S LIVINGROOM. JUST AFTER. 15 Calvin throws his pillow and comforter on the couch and collapses on top of them. He wraps himself in the comfort and switches off the light.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She’s so cute. EXT. PARK. DAY. 16 Calvin is sitting on the grass, a book open in front of h Standing a few feet away is the GIRL from his dream. She holds a sketch pad and wears a summer dress.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Your dog. She’s so cute. Scotty trots over and sits by Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: He’s a boy dog.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: He just peed like a girl.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Have we met before? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 13.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I wouldn't get too close. He’s a little scared of people.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I draw him?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Go ahead. She sits cross-legged on the grass and starts to draw.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're an artist?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m super good. What’s your dog’s name?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Are you Scottish?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No, I’m half Lithuanian.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Is he Scottish?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I named him for F. Scott Fitzgerald. The girl looks up from her drawing.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: F. Scott Fitzgerald. The novelist? “The Great Gatsby”?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (Going back to her drawing) I don’t read a lot of fiction.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You’ve never heard of F. Scott Fitzgerald. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 14.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Why, is he really famous and important?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: He’s probably one of the greatest novelists who ever lived.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: (Looking up) How do you know he’s one of the greatest novelists who ever lived? Have you read every novel ever written?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (Super annoyed) -..-No. But I ama novelist. I know a lot about novels. And Fitzgerald is pretty much the best.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay. (Going back to her sketch) But I don’t think you like him very much.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Naming your dog after him? It’s a little disrespectful.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: It’s a gesture.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah, an aggressive gesture. Think about it: you're a novelist, you think this guy is the greatest, you name your dog after him to cut him down to size. Now you can put him on a leash and yell “Bad Scotty” and feel all superior ‘cuz you pee inside. Kill your idols, man, I’m all for it. Calvin is annoyed. He gets up to go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 18 19 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 15.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang on. She rips off the page and hands it to him. It’s an incredibly beautiful sketch of Scotty. Calvin looks at he

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: This is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Your dog might pee like a lady, but I like him anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I like him. Just the way he is.

dialogues.speaker: JUMP CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CALVIN’S LIVNGROOM. DAY. Calvin sits straight up on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: YESI@@i))iide The sound of type-writer typing rapidly over: INT. CALVIN’S HOUSE. DAY AND NIGHT. Images in super fast motion: Calvin writes. Scotty’s tail thumps. Calvin revises with whiteout. Scotty runs in with a HIGH HEELED SHOE in his mouth. Calvin looks at it weird, then throws it for Scott Scotty chews on the high heel. Calvin types like a mad person. The “ding!” of the typewriter ends the sequence. INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE. ONE WEEK LATER.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You are a genius!!!! Calvin stands, arms held above his head in triumph. Dr. Rosenthal looks pleased with himself.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I thought we weren’t going to use that word, Calvin. Calvin sits. Still happy. 16 17 18 19 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 16. 19

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Okay: you are really really really super fucking smart. “I’d like it to be bad.” Can I tell you what it’s about? Maybe I shouldn’t, it could kill the... Fuck it, it’s amazing, can I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Okay: there’s this guy, this neurotic writer guy, and he’s all lonely, but then he meets this girl, and at first he doesn’t like her, but then it turns out... (Hearing himself, lamely) She's perfect for him. It’s way less trite than it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I’m glad you found something that inspires you.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Inspires me? It overwhelms me. I literally cannot sleep or eat. All I want to do is write. I almost didn’t come here today, because I didn’t want to be away from... (A terrible realization) Oh god. Oh god.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I can’t say it out loud, it’s too stupid.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I love it when you say stupid things.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: This is really profoundly stupid.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Soooo...The guy I’m writing?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: What’s his name? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 17.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Calvin. I’m going to change it. Anyway, there’s a lot of me in him? And he’s falling for this girl... WHAT I'M TRYING TO SAY IS: It’s almost like I’m writing to spend time with her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: The girl. The one I’m writing. I go to sleep at night waiting to get to my typewriter again so I can be with her. It’s like... (Whispers) It’s almost like I’m in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: (Whispers) That’s wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No. It’s not. I can’t be in love with the girl I’m writing.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: She’s not real.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: YES I’M SURE!!!! SHE'S A MOTHER FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: PRODUCT OF MY IMAGINATION
dialogues.text: Calvin buries his head in the seat cushions. Dr. Rosentha waits.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lila treated me so badly.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Who leaves someone right after their father dies?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Someone who couldn’t love you properly.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Someone who is a heartless cunt.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: Okay. Calvin remains supine. Dr. Rosenthal looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me about her.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about Lila anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I meant this girl you're writing. Tell me about her. Calvin looks at Dr. Rosenthal, full of feeling.

dialogues.text: Ruby. DREAMY SONG kicks in, over: 20 EXT. PARK. DAY. Close up on the Girl’s backside. She’s roller skating.

dialogues.text: Ruby’s first crushes were Humphrey Bogart and John Lennon. She cried when she found out they were already dead. Images of Bogart, Lennon, Ruby as a child. EXT. ROAD. DAY. Teenage Ruby (nose ring, dyed black hair) clings to the b of some dude on a motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)

dialogues.text: Ruby’s not so good at life sometimes. She forgets to open bills or cash checks.
25 26 27 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 20.

dialogues.text: Ruby tries on a dress. Mounds of clothes lay discarded on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: She used to have an eating disorder, but she doesn’t tell anyone about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby bikes ahead. The camera tries to keep up. *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Her last boyfriend was forty-nine. The one before that was an alcoholic. She can feel a change coming. She’s looking for it. The camera stops trying to follow her. Ruby bikes into th distance, getting smaller and smaller.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Something...new. Ruby disappears over a hill. DREAMY SONG fades out. Hold the empty path for a moment. The sound of someone panting Calvin enters frame near camera, running. He stops by a t to catch his breath. He calls to someone behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s stop for a second. Harry enters frame at a jog, with Scotty on leash. He slo to a stop and waits for his brother to catch his breath. INT. CALVIN’'S HOUSE. LATER. 27 Calvin and Harry enter, still in their sweaty jogging clothes, carrying a small bag of groceries.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (Calling out) They didn’t have paprika, so I got cumin. That's basically the same, right? Harry's wife SUSIE (mid-thirties, ethnic) pops out of the kitchen, carrying their baby, MILES. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Oh my woman... * He wraps himself around her. Susie laughs, pushing him aw

JUST AFTER. 29 Calvin, dressed, comes downstairs carrying the razor and shaving cream. Harry is on the couch playing with Miles a watching football. Susie’s setting the table. *

dialogues.text: Harry. *

dialogues.text: What is what? 29 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Leave it--don’t-- * Harry comes over and looks in the drawer. We see: Apparently Calvin has been collecting women’s things. In addition to the bra, there’s a pair of panties, a stockin brush, and the high heel Scotty brought in.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Off.

dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.text: Calvin. Throw. These. Away. 30 INT. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. EVENING. 30 Calvin puts the last of the dishes away. In the living ro Susie feeds Miles while watching a movie. Calvin comes ov She looks up at him and smiles. 31 EXT. CALVIN’S YARD. JUST AFTER. 31 Calvin approaches Harry, who is sprawled out on a lounge chair reading a stack of pages. Calvin sits at his feet. They are illuminated by the blue light of the pool. Harry puts down the last page.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ..-Where do you see this going? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you writing about?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I just started.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This is a love story, right? You know who reads love stories? Women. And I’m telling you, no woman is going to want to read this.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Fuck you, it’s romantic.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Quirky messy women whose problems only make them more endearing are Not. Real. Period. What do they say, write what you been through?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (Muttered) Write what you know.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Write what you know.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’ve known girls like Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Who?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Girls.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lila?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Not fucking Lila.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Right. You've had one relationship--

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: For five years-- 24. 31 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 25.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You never even lived together. I’m telling you, this honeymoon shit doesn’t last.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Women are different up close. I love Susie, but she’s a weirdo. She smells terrible when she’s anxious, and sometimes she gets mean as fuck for no reason. She’s a person. You haven’t written a person, you've written a girl.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (Suddenly angry) Whatever. Most writers don’t let people read their work at this stage. I might not even finish it. Silence. Calvin picks up the manuscript.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't, like, tell people about it, okay? Don’t tell Susie. Or Mom. Harry puts a hand on Calvin’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I’m not saying you can’t write. You could write since you could hold a crayon. I’m saying you don’t know jack shit about girls. Calvin cracks the smallest possible smile. 32 EXT. CALVIN’S HOUSE. EVENING. 32 Harry starts the motor as Susie gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: SUSIE
dialogues.text: Don’t let those leftovers go to waste, okay skinny? Harry leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY

He holds up the bra. Examines it, quizzical. INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. LATER. 34 Calvin's hands on the typewriter keys, tapping out words. CLOSE ON his face. His mouth moves as he writes.

dialogues.text: You know what I thought the first time I * saw you? I thought: Look at that * beautiful boy. I’m going to love him * forever and ever and ever. *

MORNING. 37 Calvin wakes with a start. Drooling onto his typewriter. The phone is ringing and his cell phone alarm is going of

dialogues.text: What the fuck!l!!!!!iir! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Dr. Rosenthal, it’s Calvin Weir-Fields. Something has, um, come up, and I'd appreciate it if you called me? Calvin checks behind him. Ruby finds a whisk.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Remember how Dad used to say I had an “over-active imagination”? 32.

dialogues.speaker: 37A
dialogues.text: 38 We travel down the phone cord to find Calvin, hiding unde his desk, cradling the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (On the phone) Wait. Ruby is in your house.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I started seeing her this morning. It’s like that movie “Harvey.” Except she’s not a giant rabbit. It’s not like she knows she’s imaginary, either. She thinks we’re in the relationship in my book. It is freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BETWEEN
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 33. 38A INT. HARRY’S OFFICE. SIMULTANEOUS. 38A Harry, in the middle of a very important-looking meeting.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look. There is no possible way that “Ruby” is in your house, because she is not a real person.

dialogues.text: I know she’s not! Stop telling me she’s not!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is this about last night? I shouldn’t have said anything.

dialogues.text: No no no no. I know objectively she’s not real, but I’m telling you: I can see her, I can smell her, when she touched me, I could feel it. She’s making eggs in my kitchen. Actual eggs. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Calvin. I am at work. I am in a very important meeting. I cannot handle your shit right now. Calvin emits a high-pitched keening sound.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen to me. I want you to leave the house. See a friend. A friend who can’t see your imaginary friend. If this is still an issue tonight, we will talk. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Okay. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.text: No.

And then I had a dream, and the dream made me think, hey, maybe there is a girl out there for me. I imagined what she looked like and smelled like and all her favorite things. And one day I woke up and she was there. And turns out, she makes me happy. She makes me feel not alone on this planet. Now I know this isn’t how most people meet-— Harry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Honey, I’m trying to read. * Ruby looks at Calvin, then at the steak she’s cooking. Sh turns off the burner and leaves the room. Calvin looks up

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ruby? INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. DARK. 75 Calvin opens the door. Ruby is lying on the bed in the da Calvin turns on the bedside light. Ruby wipes tears away.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know how I got here. Calvin blanches.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Shuffling around waiting on you. I don’t * know who this is. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She nods. Calvin hugs Ruby. His face is troubled. He lets go and He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You don’t have to cook.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: That’s not... You spent all weekend reading that stupid book. Your mom and Mort were trying so hard...

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: And you don’t...You don’t have any friends.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I have you. I don’t need anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of pressure.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You don’t have friends either.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I used to. I had a lot of friends.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You did? He tries to wrap his brain around that.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (Whispers) I’m so lonely.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No. No. Don’t say that. wipes away her tears.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What can we do? How can we make it better?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: ...Maybe I could take an art class. 71. 75 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 77 78 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 72.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Great. An art class. Get out of the house. Good.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: And I think I should start spending some nights at my apartment. I miss having my * own space.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I cleared out that closet for you.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: One night. As an experiment.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 76 Calvin in bed alone. He’s wide awake. He turns over, look at Ruby’s side of the bed. He looks at the clock: 4.45 AM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits on his front stoop. Scotty jumps up as Ruby * pulls up on her bicycle. INT. CALVIN’S HOUSE. JUST AFTER. 78 Ruby takes off her helmet, bag, jacket as she walks in.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: It’s mostly older people, but the talent level is really high. I think I’m going to learn a lot. Ruby finally looks at Calvin. He looks terrible.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How was your night?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Terrible.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t think this experiment is going to work for me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 79 80 81 82 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 73.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: There has to be space in the relationship. Otherwise, it’s like we're the same person. One night a week. I think you can handle it. She walks away. Calvin looks after her. INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. Scotty sleeps in the bed next to Calvin. Calvin's awake. Alone. The clock ticks incredibly loudly. INT. CALVIN'’S KITCHEN. EVENING. Loud OPERA MUSIC. Calvin tries to make pasta. It’s a mess The phone rings. He picks up instantly.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Hi, where are you? INT. BAR. SIMULTANEOUS. Ruby stands with a crowd of people.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, a bunch of people from class decided to go out. Someone gestures to her with a drink. She nods. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. SIMULTANEOUS.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: When are you coming home?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We just got here.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: But I cooked. (Silence. ) Hello? I cooked?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry, yeah. I think we’re going to eat here. I mean, we already ordered. Calvin takes in the mess he’s made.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: So when are you coming home? 78 79 80 81 82

dialogues.speaker: 82B
dialogues.text: 83 84 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 74.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. We’re drinking, and your place is kind of far.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I‘1l pick you up. Ruby fiddles with a straw.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Yeah... I might be kind of late. Let’s see each other tomorrow. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. SIMULTANEOUS. 82B Calvin stands there.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Calvin?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Have a great time. He hangs up on her. INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. NIGHT. 83 Calvin's alone in bed again. Awake. Finally he sits up, turns on the light. Looks at Ruby’s empty side of the bed INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. JUST AFTER. 84 Calvin unlocks the drawer. He takes out the last page of manuscript and puts it in the typewriter. His hands hover over the keys. Then he types, each key firing off like a in the night. Ruby was miserable without Calvin. She had to be near him all the time, or she would become despondent. He sits back in his chair. The phone rings. He picks up.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: (In tears) I want to come home.  85 86 87 88

dialogues.speaker: 88A
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 75. INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. LATER. 85 Calvin and Ruby hold each other, faces inches apart. Calv moves to extricate himself from her grasp. Ruby clutches him, mostly asleep.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Stay. INT. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. MORNING. 86 Calvin and Ruby sit next to each other, eating Cheerios f the same bowl, reading the paper. Ruby eats left-handed s they can hold hands. Calvin turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I miss you right now. She bursts into tears. INT. CALVIN’S LIVNGROOM. LATER. 87 Calvin and Ruby lie curled up, watching some old movie. T phone rings. He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: To get the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Can I come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin drives. Ruby holds his hand. He has to extricate i to turn. She takes it as soon as he’s finished the maneuv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, holding Ruby’s hand, approaches the box office.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Two for the 7.45. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 76.

dialogues.speaker: BOX OFFICE TELLER
dialogues.text: It’s sold out. There’s a 9 0’ clock.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (to Ruby) We could take a walk first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin and Ruby walk through the crowd of tourists, stree vendors, club-goers, etc. Intense press of people. Calvin phone rings. Distracted, he lets go of Ruby’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: (Picking up phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, look who answered their phone! Ruby stops walking where he dropped her hand. Calvin continues on across the street, not noticing.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Cyrus, um, sorry, I’ve been really busy.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No worries! Busy writing? Cause, you know, I keep telling them you're working on it, but the publishers are getting kind of anxious about the new book. You seemed pretty excited about it a while back. Any progress since then?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, I’m out right now, but-- Calvin turns to Ruby to mouth “One second”--but she’s not there. He whips around. Ruby is nowhere to be found. Calvin panics.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, look, I know you got your whole process. But if I could give them some kind of timeline--

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Cy, I’m gonna call you back.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What? Calvin hangs up on him. Searches the crowd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 90 91 92 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 77.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Ruby! * Across the street--a flash of color. Was that her? *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ruby! He attempts to cross the street. Cars whiz by. Calvin get more anxious. Finally, the light changes. Calvin dashes across the street, through the crowds to: Ruby, who just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! I turned around and you were gone!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You let go of my hand.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What?! INT. CALVIN’S BEDROOM. LATER. 90 Ruby cries in bed, inconsolable. Calvin strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Ruby. Sweetie. You have to calm down. I’ll get you some water. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You didn’t even notice I was gone. * INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. JUST AFTER. 91 Calvin sits in front of his typewriter, page inserted and waiting. He thinks for a minute, then he types: Ruby was filled with the most delicious, effervescent happiness. She didn’t worry about Calvin leaving. There wasn’t any room for worry in all that joy. INT. CALVIN’S HALLWAY. JUST AFTER. 92 Calvin climbs the stairs, glass of water in hand. He open the bedroom door. Ruby sits on the bed grinning at him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Hi dummy. * She laughs. *  96 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 78. EXT. CALVIN'’S YARD. DAY. 96 Ruby and Susie are in the pool with baby Miles. Harry man the BAR-B-QUE. Calvin comes up with two beers.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks. A peal of laughter from the pool. Calvin looks at Ruby, t angles his body away from her.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What if I told you I was writing again?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s fantastic. What’s it about?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No. Writing. Again. Calvin gestures with his head toward Ruby. Harry gets it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh. (Eyeing Ruby) The tits?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No. No, nothing...like that. (Low) She wasn’t happy, so I...made her happy. And now she’s like this... Peal of laughter from Ruby in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ---all the time.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you asking me? If it’s moral? I don’t know. It’s obviously working. Think of it like Prozac.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: But how do I know it’s real? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It’s not. She’s not.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: She was. (Beat) I want to be what’s making her happy. Without making her happy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: So write “Ruby went back to normal.” No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ...I think she was going to leave me. Before. Harry considers this, flips a burger.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Susie left once.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: While ago. Before we were engaged.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You had a lot going on. And she came back. But I still think about it. I could lose her any moment.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You're married, you’ve got a kid. She’d never leave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nothing’s permanent. It’s dangerous to love someone. In the pool, Ruby laughs again. Calvin looks at her. 97 INT. CALVIN'S KITCHEN. LATER. 79. Calvin and Ruby’s backs at the sink as they do the dishes

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m thinking of going away for a few months. By myself. 96 97 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 80.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Where do you wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Somewhere far.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You could send me post cards. I love getting mail. She smiles. Unperturbed. Calvin tries again.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Or I might hole up here. In the house. Not even go outside.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Cool. We could build a pillow fort! Calvin stops doing the dishes. He takes Ruby’s face in hi hands. Forces her to look at him. There’s a moment of silence. She giggles. Calvin’s eyes as he takes her in. 98 INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. LATER. 98 CLOSE ON: The last page of the manuscript. The ball of th typewriter rips across the page: Ruby There is a moment of waiting. Then the rest of the senten Ruby was just Ruby. Happy or sad, however she felt. Whoev she might be. CLOSE ON Calvin's face as he considers what he has done. FADE TO BLACK. 100 INT. CALVIN’S LIVINGROOM. LATE AFTERNOON. 100 Ruby is stretched out on the couch, watching “America’s N Top Model”. There’s a half-eaten pan of brownies next to her, and gossip magazines strewn all over. The sound of the front door opening. Ruby makes no move t clean up. Scotty runs in and bee lines to Ruby, who pushe him away with her feet. Calvin comes in with his dry cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? We have Langdon’s party. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 81.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Langdon Tharp. The writer. His book party’s tonight? Ruby’s eyes are on the TV. Calvin walks over, turns it of

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Hey! I was watching that.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, for days.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: It’s a marathon.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You were always asking me to make plans for us. I did. Get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell me what I used to say. I’m allowed to change my mind!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to fight about this.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Great. Let’s ignore it, then. Ruby snaps the TV on. Calvin turns it off. Standoff. Ruby covers her face with her hands. Calvin sits next to her.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Everything’s been so up and down recently. It’s like my internal compass is just...gone. Maybe I should talk to someone. You used to see someone, right?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Dr. Rosenthal.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go back.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I thought we were talking about you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 101 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 82.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: We are. We are. Never mind. (Wiping away her tears) Maybe you’re right. Maybe I do need to get out. See people.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: This party will be fun. I promise. INT. LANGDON THARP’S HOUSE. BOOK PARTY. NIGHT. 101 Scary hip Silverlake mingles with scary slick Hollywood, house as spare and glassy as a shark tank.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Please take me home.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cal! Cyrus charges at them, an anorexic brunette on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? You have to talk to Adam and Mandi.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Adam and Mandi. The producers who want to take over your option? Check your messages.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Wait, wait. Cy. This is Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Ohhh. Hi. Cyrus. Ruby. Nice. (Referring to his date) This is Saskia. Cal? Cyrus grabs Calvin's elbow. Calvin turns back to Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Stay there, I’1l be right back. They're gone. Ruby turns to Saskia.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Do you wanna get a drink? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SASKIA
dialogues.text: I’m on a juice fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saskia talks to some guys. Ruby holds a drink. Across the room, ADAM and MANDI (20s, eager) and Cyrus and another a WARREN all talk at Calvin. *

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Would you want to write the screenplay yourself?

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Of course he is, who else is gonna do it? *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I’ve never written one... *

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: Oh my god, you’re such a genius, you’d * pick it up like that.

dialogues.speaker: WARREN
dialogues.text: That's what we keep telling him! * Ruby gives up waiting for Calvin, wanders off. Calvin doe not notice, but Langdon, across the room, spots Ruby walk alone, looking lost. He notes it, returns to his fans. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby wanders through the house. Pictures of Langdon. Strange objects. She picks up a telescope, looks through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Adam/Mandi/Cyrus/Warren situation has gotten more * intense. Calvin looks even more desperate to get away. *

dialogues.speaker: MANDI
dialogues.text: Who would you want to play Charlie? *

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s the question, right? *

dialogues.speaker: WARREN
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be huge. *

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Huge. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll be right back. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby takes off her shoes, dips a toe into the infinity po

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You like my pool? * Langdon stands across the pool with a bottle of wine. *

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin tries to make his way through the party.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, excuse me. A girl stands with her back to Calvin, blocking his path.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, excuse me. The girl turns around. Calvin stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Cal.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Langdon moves a little closer. He’s pleasantly drunk.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: What are you doing at my party?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Did you come with someone?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Calvin. Weir-Fields. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 85.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: So, are you the kind of girl who only dates famous writers?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Why, are you a famous writer? 108 INT. PARTY. SIMULTANEOUS. Lila is soft and serious. Calvin looks like he’s had the wind knocked out of him.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I thought you were in New York.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Langdon’s helping me get my novel published. He didn’t tell you?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You finished your novel?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Couple months ago. (Pained) Big surprise, right? The dilettante finished something.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I never said that. 109 EXT. PARTY. SIMULTANEOUS. Langdon and Ruby are now a few feet apart.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: You don’t happen to have a name, do you?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Ruby.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Ruby. What do you do, Ruby?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: How refreshing. What do you do in your spare time?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Not much. 107 108 109  He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft INT. PARTY. SIMULTANEOUS.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: I hear you’re seeing someone.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah. She’s here.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Is she a writer?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No. A painter. Lila smiles, chagrined.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Sounds great. Very unthreatening.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You think I was threatened by you?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Why would you be? You’re a genius.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Don’t use that word. (Beat) So, what, Langdon introduced you to his agent? Publisher?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sure it must be good, if Langdon’s helping you. Lila mutters something.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Nothing. I’m not fucking him, if that’s what you’re implying.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I really don’t care what you do. EXT. PARTY. SIMULTANEOUS. 86. 110 111 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: .--.-Tell me: how does a novelist get such a fancy house in the Hollywood Hills?

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: By selling out very early. Why do I feel like I know you?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I guess I have that kind of face.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: ---You know what I was thinking? I was just thinking this would be a perfect night for a swim.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I don’t have a suit.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Is that a problem? INT. PARTY. SIMULTANEOUS. The argument has escalated.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, how was I anything but supportive? I read every draft you gave me. I brought you into my writer's group, I introduced you to Langdon.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: (Under her breath) Begrudgingly.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What? I literally can’t hear you.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Begrudgingly, begrudgingly. You weren't curious about me. You never were. You had an image of who I was, and anything I did that contradicted it, you ignored.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What image? The one where you left me as soon as I wasn’t successful?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: You think I gave a shit if you were famous? (Getting emotional) (MORE )
111 112 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 113 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 88.

dialogues.speaker: LILA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All I wanted was for you to care about me.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Care about you?! You left weeks after my father died. You really wanna talk about caring?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: (Looking around for help) Oh my god this is not happening.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Do you know what people say when I tell them how you left me?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: You were impenetrable!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: They say, how could you love a person like that?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: I tried to help, you refused to let me in.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: And I say, I have no fucking clue.

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: The only person you wanted to be ina relationship with was you. So I let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Wow. You really let yourself off the hook, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: LILA
dialogues.text: Good bye, Cal.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, bye, have a great life. Calvin storms away, fuming. He makes his way to the back the house, looking for Ruby. Then he sees, through the op glass doors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby, on the edge of the pool, pulls off her dress. She’s her bra and panties. Calvin steps onto the patio, confuse (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 89.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I keep it very warm. Langdon’s in his underwear in the pool, peeking through h fingers.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You promised not to look!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What’s going on here? Ruby freezes. Langdon uncovers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LANGDON THARP
dialogues.text: Calvin. We thought we’d take a dip. Care to join us?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 114 INT. CALVIN’S CAR. JUST AFTER. 114 Calvin and Ruby ride in stony silence. Ruby flips on the radio. Calvin flips it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruby comes into the house ahead of Calvin and immediately reaches for Scotty’s leash.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Scotty! Calvin shuts the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You know what.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Oh, grow up. Calvin grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop! You’re hurting me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 90. 115

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Explain what you were doing.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You left me alone at a party where I didn’t know anyone. I found someone to talk to.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: In your underwear.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Would you have been mad if I was wearing my bikini?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You weren’t wearing your bikini. Do you know how it looked? My agent was there. My ex was there!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Lila was there? Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Because I was too busy getting you to PUT YOUR CLOTHES BACK ON. You’re supposed to be my girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I am your girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: So act like it!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I wasn’t acting like your platonic ideal of a girlfriend. You can be such a fucking prude.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Because I don’t want you skinny dipping with other men?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Because you don’t want me doing ANYTHING! You have all these rules! And you don’t tell me what they are until, whoops, I’ve broken them! And then you get to be disappointed with me! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 91.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You want to know my rules? Don’t fuck other men! Don’t let them think about fucking you!

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: So I’m responsible for what other people are thinking?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: You are responsible! When you act a certain way, it leads people on. If you take your clothes off at a party, it makes people think you’re a slut. So I'd really prefer if you didn’t do that. Is that clear enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I am not your child. You don’t get to decide what I do. Ruby starts to put on her coat.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure I can make you do whatever I want.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do, tie me up?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Nope. I don’t have to. Calvin leaves the room, casually. Ruby stares after him. INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. JUST AFTER. 116 Calvin takes the manuscript out of its drawer, puts the l page in the typewriter. Ruby comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Calvin. I’m leaving. I will call you tomorrow. Calvin types something quickly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 92.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Fine. Go. 116 Ruby shakes her head and turns to leave. She stops abrupt as if she’s hit a wall. She tries again. Again.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Futile. What...? What is this? What’s going on? Calvin pulls the paper out of the typewriter and hands it her. She reads: Ruby could not leave Calvin’s house. She couldn’t his office. Ruby looks up at Calvin, equal parts confusion and

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: This is my book. The one I haven’t been working on. Wanna see? He hands her the previous page. She skims over it. old commands, other things Calvin has written.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Is this some kind of joke?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No, it’s pretty serious. even leave terror. We see Ruby picks up other pages of the manuscript. Calvin watch her. As she reads, the color drains from her face.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What...what is this? You’re writing about me? How did you know this, about my teacher? Have you been talking to people about me?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: This is private. You can’t do this, you can’t write about me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Silence. He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 93.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m not writing about you. I wrote you. I made you up.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I had a dream about a girl. I wrote it down. I gave her a name. Ruby. I wrote all kinds of things about her. And one day I woke up and she--you--were living in my house. I can make you do anything. Because you’re not real. Ruby stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You're sick. Jesus, you made me up?! Let me tell you something, Calvin: you are not the center of the fucking universe. If this is how you think of other people, then you are in for a long, lonely, fucked up life. He types something.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Je te jure, tu ferais mieux d’ecoutez ce que j’ai... Mon Dieu. Je parle francais? Mais, je ne sais pas parler francais. Qu’est-ce-que-- [I swear to god, you better listen to what I'm-- Oh my god. Am I speaking French? I don't know how to speak French! What--] Calvin picks up a page, shows her:

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: “Ruby speaks French.”

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Mon Dieu! Qu’est-ce-qui m’arrive? [Oh my god. What's happening? ]

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I told you. I can make you do anything. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 94,

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Qu’est-ce-qui se passe? Mais, comment est-ce que tu fais ca? [What is this? How are you doing this?]

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: It’s simple. I write it. (Types something) You do it. Ruby’s fingers start snapping. She stares at her hand as it doesn't belong to her.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Mon Dieu! Arrete! Arrete! [Oh my god, stop! Stop!] Calvin types something. Ruby starts to sing and strip. The song continues over as we see: Calvin types, Ruby does. The hammers of the typewriter, t violence of his fingers hitting the keys. Glimpses of the words he writes and fast cuts of: --Ruby spinning and chanting “I love you, I’1l never leav you.” --Ruby down on her knees, barking like a dog. --Ruby dancing and yelling “I love your mouth, I love you face, I love your cock,” etc. --Ruby jumping up and down and cheering “You’re a genius!

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY
dialogues.text: Calvin slams his hands down on the keyboard, jamming the letters. Ruby collapses. They are both shaking, silent. After a long beat, Calvin raises his head, afraid to look her. Ruby is on the ground, barely breathing. Calvin edges toward her, terrified. She doesn’t move. He puts a tentative hand on her--and she JUMPS UP and runs o of the room. We hear the door slam behind her. Calvin is alone. + eH  He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 95. 122 INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. 122 A page sits, waiting, in the typewriter. Calvin thinks. After a moment he sits forward and types something. He removes the page. Reads what he’s written.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As soon as Ruby left the house, the past released her. She was no longer Calvin's creation. From that moment on, only Ruby could determine the course her life. She was free. Calvin walks down the hall and places the manuscript in f of the bedroom door. On the title page is a post-it note: “Ruby. Look at the last page. I love you. Calvin.” Calvin sits, leaning against the wall, waiting for Ruby t open the door.

dialogues.speaker: LATER. 123
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON Calvin's face. Scotty’s nose enters frame. He kisses Calvin vigorously. Calvin opens his eyes and sees: The bedroom door is ajar. The manuscript sits on the floo but the Post-it note is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom is stripped of Ruby’s things. Calvin goes to closet. Empty hangers where Ruby’s clothes were. Calvin curls up on the floor and cries. Scotty lies next to him, keeping him company. The light fades rapidly, day to night until we are in complete darkness. Then: A light snaps on. Calvin is still lying on the floor. Scotty sits there chewing a shoe. Feet walk over to Calvi Harry crouches down into frame.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: She’s gone. Harry helps Calvin to his feet and wraps his arms around brother in a long embrace.  125 126 127 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 96. INT. CALVIN'S KITCHEN. LATER. Harry and Calvin sit across from each other at the kitche table. Calvin eats soup. Harry watches him. Calvin stalls for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Soup. Calvin takes another bite. EXT. GOLF COURSE. DAY. Harry puts. Calvin stands there, in position to swing, bu does not move. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Nothing helps. Harry stops and looks at Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: When was the last time you wrote, Callie?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I can’t write.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sure you can. That’s what you have over every other poor schmuck out there with a broken heart. You can write about it.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Who would want to read that?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lots of people. Why not? You’ve got a pretty cool story. Calvin considers this.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Everyone will think I’m crazy.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. They'll think it’s fiction. INT. CALVIN’S OFFICE. DAY. CLOSE ON: the typewriter. Calvin’s hands enter frame, pic it up and remove it. The empty desk. His hands reenter frame and place a NEW BLACK MACBOOK in its place. 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Calvin sits at his desk. He opens the laptop. His hands hover over the keys. Then, Calvin begins to type. *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is the true and impossible story of * my very great love.” * CUT to reveal him sitting in the chair Mort made for him. INT. CALVIN’S KITCHEN. EVENING. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin cooks for himself, neatly. Dinner for one.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the hope that she will not read it and * reproach me, I have withheld many telling * details. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin runs. *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Her name, the particulars of her birth * and upbringing, any identifying scars or * birthmarks. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin walks Scotty alone. It is fall, he wears a coat. *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All the same, I cannot help but write * this for her. To tell her, I’m sorry for * every word I wrote to change you. I’m * sorry for so many things. * INT. CALVIN’S LIVNGROOM. DAY. * Calvin opens a package. Inside is a copy of his book (tha we're hearing an excerpt from): “The Girfriend.” He turns to the dedication page. “For her.” *

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I coudn’t see you when you were here. * And now that you’re gone, I see you * everywhere. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans over the crowd until it lands on Calvin, reading aloud. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 98.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: “One may read this and think it’s magic-- but falling in love is an act of magic. So is writing.” We see in the small crowd: Mort, Gertrude, Harry, and Sus

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “It was once said of Cather in the Rye, ‘That rare miracle of fiction has again come to pass: a human being has been created out of ink, paper, and the imagination.’ I am no J.D. Salinger, but I have witnessed a rare miracle. Any writer can attest, in the luckiest, happiest state, the words are not coming from you, but through you.” Calvin pauses, looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “She came to me wholly herself. I was just lucky enough to be there to catch her.” LATER. Calvin talks with his family. Cyrus sidles up.

dialogues.speaker: CYRUS
dialogues.text: Where have you been? I’ve got people dying to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Cyrus, you've met my family. Calvin gestures toward Gertrude, Mort, Harry, and Susie.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hey dude. Mort gives Cyrus a big hug. Cyrus looks discombobulated.

dialogues.speaker: MORT
dialogues.text: Doesn’t his imagination just blow you away? I mean, where does he come up with these things, right? Calvin looks at Harry. Harry winks at him. Calvin smiles. We pan out from our little group, enjoying the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH  131 132 133 He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 99, INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE. DAY. Rosenthal flips through the book. They both laugh. Rosenthal puts the book aside. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: It’s beautiful, Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Dr. ROSENTHAL Most of my patients don’t take my assignments this seriously.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I know you hoped...that by writing this, I would realize that it never happened. 131 Calvin sits, watching him. A beat. That I imagined her. Or went crazy for a while. And I understand why that would be easier. It would make more sense. But the thing is: I don’t need to make sense of this. I don’t care if there’s no good explanation. If I’m going to keep coming here, I need you to believe me anyway. Take the leap. At least imagine how it could be true. For me.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSENTHAL
dialogues.text: I will work on that. INT. CALVIN’S CAR. LATER. 132 Calvin drives with the windows down, Scotty hanging his h out. A happy song plays. Calvin sings along. EXT. PARK. DAY. Off leash, Scotty roams ahead of Calvin. beauty of the day. Suddenly, Scotty takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Scotty! 133 Calvin takes in the Scotty bee-lines over to a girl on a blanket, reading in sun. She laughs and pets him. Calvin comes over.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I-- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 100.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Calvin stops. It’s Ruby. Her hair is shorter, but it’s he She looks up at Calvin...and smiles. Blank.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: It’s fine. He’s so friendly. She pets Scotty. Calvin crouches down, searching her face his heart racing. It’s definitely her...isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s his name?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: ---Scotty.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: That’s funny, that’s the name of the dog in this book. She points to her book: “The Girlfriend.” Calvin picks it

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you read it? Calvin nods, head reeling. He absently flips through page

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you like it? Calvin's eye catches: As soon as she left the house, the past released her. He looks at the girl in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, did you say something? *

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I asked if you liked it. The book.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: What do you think of it?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Well, my friend who lent it to me thought it was kind of pretentious, but I like it so far. * (Suddenly) Have we met before?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: You seem so familiar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He Loves Me 6/09/11 Draft 101.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She looks at him searchingly. He watches, waiting for a glimmer of recognition. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we knew each other in another life. Or maybe we just go to the same coffee shop. She laughs, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you do, besides go for walks with your dog?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I’m a writer.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Oh, what do you write? He holds up the book. His author photograph. She turns bright red.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So that’s why you look familiar.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: I was totally kidding about my friend calling it pretentious. (A beat.) Can we start over?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: -..-Yes. Do you mind if I sit here?

dialogues.speaker: RUBY
dialogues.text: Please. She picks up the book to make room for him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just don’t tell me how it ends, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: I promise. They continue to talk as the camera pulls back, revealing park in full bloom around them. Credits roll. The End.
